column1: In this instant case,  the appellant was  properly charged  before the Magistrate court and  he was
represented  by  a  counsel,  after  non  summary  inquiry,  the  learned  Magistrate  had  properly
complied  with  statutory provisions  of the  Code  of Criminal  Procedure  Act  No.  15  of 1979 and

committed  the  appellant  to  high  court  on 
the  same  charges.
column2: It  is  evident  that  merely  not

column1: marking  the  statutory  statement  of  the  appellant  before  closing
caused  any prejudice to the appellant or caused  miscarriage of justice.
